content.description: Begin by traversing a horizontal crack system to gain a series of good, incut monos (or two-finger pockets).  Yard up on these odd holds, taking care to use the right sequence.  Make a long, committing move to the left arete on a rounded sloping hold.  Then make another big move way off the deck to the positive holds at the top.  There could be cosequences to a fall here.  Mantle.
content.location: Underneath some bolted route, by a cave on a hill of Devil's Den

climbs.name: Red Right Hand aka Spitting Blood

content.description:
This beautiful climb is a fantastic addition to the Devil's Den area. 

  Start sitting with both hands matched on the left side of the obvious wide rail. (The first ascentionist started with both hands matched on the sidepull feature.) Pull off the ground and move rightwards along the rail, using subtle beta, to eventually gain a good incut flake with the right hand. Then figure out a way to get your right hand to the arete/lip above (crux). This sequence is both powerful and technical. 

  Upon gaining the lip, traverse it leftwards to a monstrous top out jug. Throw a heel on and rock over. Done!
content.protection: Two or three pads are helpful as the landing is mostly talus
content.location: This climb is located uphill of 'Red' and just downhill of 'Universal Socket'. It is near the start of the route climb 'Sympathy For The Devil'.

content.description: The bolted arete above Universal Socket that's probably more suitable as a boulder problem to the obvious lip. Start low, slap up edges on either side of the arete.
content.location: Above the Universal Socket boulder is a cave, which has an obvious, clean arete on its right side. This line climbs that arete.

content.description: A powerful problem over a not so great landing. Stand start with the left hand on a smooth crimp on the lip and right hand next to it. Pull on and move out right to a decent edge. Figure out how to match and lock-off to a bad sloper and then top-out. Powerful and fun.
content.protection: Four to six pads. The landing is quite bad, and the high heelhook can feel scary and insecure.
content.location: The problem is located on the same boulder as "Red Right Hand". This line starts at the lip in the middle of the overhanging face.

content.description: Start underneath the overhanging prow with a right-hand rail and a small left-hand edge. Pull on with difficulty and make a hard move up to a good edge out left. Match, and then gun for the lip of the boulder. Once on the lip, a direct mantel is possible, or a traverse on slopers into the top out of "Red Right Hand".
content.location: This problem lies between "The Devil Wears Prana" and "Red Right Hand" on the obvious arete/ prow.

content.description: A great section of Devil's Den that is home to one of the best V6 that Pawtuckaway has to offer.
